title: Jin Huidi, Chinese Emperor of the Jin dynasty, is poisoned and succeeded by Jin Huaidi.
text: Jin Huidi, Chinese Emperor of the Jin dynasty, is poisoned and succeeded by Jin Huaidi.

title: Siyaj K'ak' conquers Waka.
text: Siyaj K'ak' conquers Waka.

title: Alfred the Great leads a West Saxon army to repel an invasion by Danelaw Vikings.
text: Alfred the Great leads a West Saxon army to repel an invasion by Danelaw Vikings.

title: François Grimaldi, disguised as a monk, leads his men to capture the fortress protecting the Rock of Monaco, establishing his family as the rulers of Monaco.
text: François Grimaldi, disguised as a monk, leads his men to capture the fortress protecting the Rock of Monaco, establishing his family as the rulers of Monaco.

title: The papal bull Romanus Pontifex awards the Kingdom of Portugal exclusive trade and colonization rights to all of Africa south of Cape Bojador.
text: The papal bull Romanus Pontifex awards the Kingdom of Portugal exclusive trade and colonization rights to all of Africa south of Cape Bojador.

title: Louis XII of France marries Anne of Brittany in accordance with a law set by his predecessor, Charles VIII.
text: Louis XII of France marries Anne of Brittany in accordance with a law set by his predecessor, Charles VIII.

title: The first Lithuanian-language book, Simple Words of Catechism, is published in Königsberg.
text: The first Lithuanian-language book, Simple Words of Catechism, is published in Königsberg.

title: Premiere performance of George Frideric Handel's Ariodante at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden.
text: Premiere performance of George Frideric Handel's Ariodante at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden.

title: Second Jacobite rising: Bonnie Prince Charlie occupies Stirling.
text: Second Jacobite rising: Bonnie Prince Charlie occupies Stirling.

title: George Washington delivers the first State of the Union address in New York City.
text: George Washington delivers the first State of the Union address in New York City.

title: Cape Colony becomes a British colony.
text: Cape Colony becomes a British colony.

title: An unsuccessful slave revolt is led by Charles Deslondes in St. Charles and St. James, Louisiana.
text: An unsuccessful slave revolt is led by Charles Deslondes in St. Charles and St. James, Louisiana.

title: War of 1812: Battle of New Orleans: Andrew Jackson leads American forces in victory over the British.
text: War of 1812: Battle of New Orleans: Andrew Jackson leads American forces in victory over the British.

title: The Democratic Party of the United States is organized.
text: The Democratic Party of the United States is organized.

title: The United States national debt is zero for the only time.
text: The United States national debt is zero for the only time.

title: American Civil War: Second Battle of Springfield
text: American Civil War: Second Battle of Springfield

title: African American men are granted the right to vote in Washington, D.C.
text: African American men are granted the right to vote in Washington, D.C.

title: Crazy Horse and his warriors fight their last battle against the United States Cavalry at Wolf Mountain, Montana Territory.
text: Crazy Horse and his warriors fight their last battle against the United States Cavalry at Wolf Mountain, Montana Territory.

title: Herman Hollerith is issued US patent #395,791 for the 'Art of Applying Statistics' — his punched card calculator.
text: Herman Hollerith is issued US patent #395,791 for the 'Art of Applying Statistics' — his punched card calculator.

title: The Blackstone Library is dedicated, marking the beginning of the Chicago Public Library system.
text: The Blackstone Library is dedicated, marking the beginning of the Chicago Public Library system.

title: The African National Congress is founded.
text: The African National Congress is founded.

title: U.S. President Woodrow Wilson announces his "Fourteen Points" for the aftermath of World War I.
text: U.S. President Woodrow Wilson announces his "Fourteen Points" for the aftermath of World War I.

title: The steel strike of 1919 ends in a complete failure for the Amalgamated Association of Iron, Steel and Tin Workers labor union.
text: The steel strike of 1919 ends in a complete failure for the Amalgamated Association of Iron, Steel and Tin Workers labor union.

title: Crown Prince Nguyễn Phúc Vĩnh Thuỵ ascends the throne, the last monarch of Vietnam.
text: Crown Prince Nguyễn Phúc Vĩnh Thuỵ ascends the throne, the last monarch of Vietnam.

title: Abdul-Aziz ibn Saud was crowned King of Hejaz.
text: Abdul-Aziz ibn Saud was crowned King of Hejaz.

title: Kashf-e hijab decree is enforced by Reza Shah ordering the police to physically remove the Hijab from any woman in public.
text: Kashf-e hijab decree is enforced by Reza Shah ordering the police to physically remove the Hijab from any woman in public.

title: World War II: Britain introduces food rationing.
text: World War II: Britain introduces food rationing.

title: World War II: Philippine Commonwealth troops under the Philippine Commonwealth Army units enter the province of Ilocos Sur in Northern Luzon and attack Japanese Imperial forces.
text: World War II: Philippine Commonwealth troops under the Philippine Commonwealth Army units enter the province of Ilocos Sur in Northern Luzon and attack Japanese Imperial forces.

title: Operation Auca: Five U.S. missionaries are killed by the Huaorani of Ecuador shortly after making contact with them.
text: Operation Auca: Five U.S. missionaries are killed by the Huaorani of Ecuador shortly after making contact with them.

title: In France a referendum supports Charles de Gaulle's policies in Algeria.
text: In France a referendum supports Charles de Gaulle's policies in Algeria.

title: Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa is exhibited in the United States for the first time, at the National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C.
text: Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa is exhibited in the United States for the first time, at the National Gallery of Art in Washington, D.C.

title: President Lyndon B. Johnson declares a "War on Poverty" in the United States.
text: President Lyndon B. Johnson declares a "War on Poverty" in the United States.

title: Bowing to international pressure, President of Pakistan Zulfikar Ali Bhutto releases Bengali leader Sheikh Mujibur Rahman from prison, who had been arrested after declaring the independence of Bangladesh.
text: Bowing to international pressure, President of Pakistan Zulfikar Ali Bhutto releases Bengali leader Sheikh Mujibur Rahman from prison, who had been arrested after declaring the independence of Bangladesh.

title: Soviet space mission Luna 21 is launched.
text: Soviet space mission Luna 21 is launched.

title: Watergate scandal: The trial of seven men accused of illegal entry into Democratic Party headquarters at Watergate begins.
text: Watergate scandal: The trial of seven men accused of illegal entry into Democratic Party headquarters at Watergate begins.

title: Ella T. Grasso becomes Governor of Connecticut, the first woman to serve as a Governor in the United States other than by succeeding her husband.
text: Ella T. Grasso becomes Governor of Connecticut, the first woman to serve as a Governor in the United States other than by succeeding her husband.

title: Three bombs explode in Moscow, Russia, Soviet Union, within 37 minutes, killing seven. The bombings are attributed to an Armenian separatist group.
text: Three bombs explode in Moscow, Russia, Soviet Union, within 37 minutes, killing seven. The bombings are attributed to an Armenian separatist group.

title: Password Plus debuts on NBC.
text: Password Plus debuts on NBC.

title: A local farmer reports a UFO sighting in Trans-en-Provence, France, claimed to be "perhaps the most completely and carefully documented sighting of all time".
text: A local farmer reports a UFO sighting in Trans-en-Provence, France, claimed to be "perhaps the most completely and carefully documented sighting of all time".

title: Breakup of the Bell System: AT&T agrees to divest itself of twenty-two subdivisions.
text: Breakup of the Bell System: AT&T agrees to divest itself of twenty-two subdivisions.

title: Kegworth air disaster: British Midland Flight 92, a Boeing 737-400, crashes into the M1 motorway, killing 47 of the 126 people on board.
text: Kegworth air disaster: British Midland Flight 92, a Boeing 737-400, crashes into the M1 motorway, killing 47 of the 126 people on board.

title: Russian cosmonaut Valeri Polyakov on Soyuz TM-18 leaves for Mir. He would stay on the space station until March 22, 1995, for a record 437 days in space.
text: Russian cosmonaut Valeri Polyakov on Soyuz TM-18 leaves for Mir. He would stay on the space station until March 22, 1995, for a record 437 days in space.

title: An Antonov An-32 cargo aircraft crashes into a crowded market in Kinshasa, Zaire, killing up to 223 on the ground; two of six crew members are also killed.
text: An Antonov An-32 cargo aircraft crashes into a crowded market in Kinshasa, Zaire, killing up to 223 on the ground; two of six crew members are also killed.

title: President George W. Bush signs into law the No Child Left Behind Act.
text: President George W. Bush signs into law the No Child Left Behind Act.

title: Turkish Airlines Flight 634 crashes near Diyarbakır Airport, Turkey, killing the entire crew and 70 of the 75 passengers.
text: Turkish Airlines Flight 634 crashes near Diyarbakır Airport, Turkey, killing the entire crew and 70 of the 75 passengers.

title: Air Midwest Flight 5481 crashes at Charlotte-Douglas Airport, Charlotte, North Carolina, killing all 21 people on board.
text: Air Midwest Flight 5481 crashes at Charlotte-Douglas Airport, Charlotte, North Carolina, killing all 21 people on board.

title: The RMS Queen Mary 2, the largest ocean liner ever built, is christened by her namesake's granddaughter, Queen Elizabeth II.
text: The RMS Queen Mary 2, the largest ocean liner ever built, is christened by her namesake's granddaughter, Queen Elizabeth II.

title: The nuclear sub USS San Francisco collides at full speed with an undersea mountain south of Guam. One man is killed, but the sub surfaces and is repaired.
text: The nuclear sub USS San Francisco collides at full speed with an undersea mountain south of Guam. One man is killed, but the sub surfaces and is repaired.

title: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake in northern Costa Rica kills 15 people and injures 32.
text: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake in northern Costa Rica kills 15 people and injures 32.

title: Gunmen from an offshoot the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda attack a bus carrying the Togo national football team on its way to the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations, killing three.
text: Gunmen from an offshoot the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda attack a bus carrying the Togo national football team on its way to the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations, killing three.

title: The attempted assassination of Arizona Representative Gabrielle Giffords and subsequent shooting in Casas Adobes, Arizona, in which five people were shot dead.
